decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counter spells, removal, and card draw, while generating card advantage and value with powerful threats like Teferi, Niv-Mizzet, and Enigma Drake. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while setting up win conditions through incremental advantage and late game card advantage. The mana base is built to support the diverse color requirements of the spells in the deck, allowing for flexibility and consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is focused on aggressive plays, utilizing creatures with explore and life gain abilities to quickly establish a board presence. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down to deal with opposing threats. Vivien Reid provides card advantage and removal options, while Doom Whisperer and Carnage Tyrant are strong finishers. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with efficient creatures and removal while maintaining a steady flow of threats to pressure the opponent.

The focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker, while also disrupting their plans with removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. The deck aims to generate value through its graveyard recursion abilities with cards like Memorial to Folly and Find / Finality. With a strong mix of creatures, removal, and card advantage, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a blend of aggression and resilience.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful control spells and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. Cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Niv-Mizzet, Parun provide card advantage and control options, while Crackling Drake serves as a win condition. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Seal Away, while countering key spells with Sinister Sabotage and Syncopate. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements and help ensure smooth casting of spells throughout the game.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on ramping up with Llanowar Elves and Druid of the Cowl to quickly play powerful creatures like Carnage Tyrant and Ravenous Chupacabra. Utilizing cards like Jadelight Ranger and Merfolk Branchwalker to maintain card advantage, Wildgrowth Walker for life gain, and Vraska's Contempt for removal, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and powerful creatures. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Karn, Scion of Urza and Vivien Reid for additional value and card advantage, while Find / Finality provides both graveyard recursion and board clear potential.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger, Llanowar Elves, and Wildgrowth Walker. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats and protect its own creatures. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Karn, Scion of Urza and Vivien Reid adds additional card advantage and versatility to the deck. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overpowering opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards that can both draw more cards and deal damage, the deck aims to maintain a high tempo and pressure the opponent into making mistakes. The inclusion of cards like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake provide both aggressive threats and card advantage, while cards like Goblin Electromancer help to reduce the cost of spells, allowing for more impactful plays on each turn. Overall, the deck aims to outpace opponents and close out games quickly.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, aggressive white creatures. By quickly establishing a board presence with cards like Adanto Vanguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Hunted Witness, players can efficiently push for damage and control the board. Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon provide boosts to all creatures, while cards like Conclave Tribunal and History of Benalia offer removal and additional creature generation. Lyra Dawnbringer serves as a powerful finisher, while Pride of Conquerors can provide a final push for victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent by using efficient and low-cost creatures and burn spells. By constantly pressuring the opponent and maintaining a fast-paced tempo, the deck aims to overwhelm and defeat the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. The inclusion of cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy allows for explosive turns and card advantage, further increasing the deck's potential for overwhelming the opponent.

This deck focuses on applying constant pressure on the opponent by utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponents' game plan. By ramping up mana with Llanowar Elves and Druid of the Cowl, the deck can quickly play powerful threats like Carnage Tyrant and Vivien Reid. It also has strong card advantage engines with cards like Jadelight Ranger and Midnight Reaper to ensure a steady flow of resources. The Golgari color combination allows for a versatile mix of creatures and removal spells to maintain board dominance and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to establish a strong board presence early in the game using efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves, Merfolk Branchwalker, and Wildgrowth Walker. This is coupled with removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt to clear the way for attacking. The deck also utilizes card advantage with cards like Jadelight Ranger and Vivien Reid, while also having finishers like Doom Whisperer and Vraska, Relic Seeker. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain board control throughout the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly establish board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Merfolk Branchwalker, and then use cards like Wildgrowth Walker to gain life and Carnage Tyrant to apply pressure. The deck also includes removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Planeswalkers like Vivien Reid and Vraska, Golgari Queen provides additional card advantage and versatility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and resilience.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and other powerful creatures, allowing for explosive and aggressive plays early in the game. With cards like Crackling Drake and Murmuring Mystic to provide additional threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of flying creatures and direct burn spells. By efficiently cycling through the deck and utilizing mana reduction effects, the deck can maintain a consistent stream of threats while maintaining card advantage and tempo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful spells and removal, utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Deafening Clarion to dictate the pace of the match. The deck aims to maintain board control with cards like Settle the Wreckage and Seal Away, while also drawing cards and generating card advantage with Chemister's Insight and Expansion / Explosion. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Lyra Dawnbringer to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to stall and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Using Teferi, Hero of Dominaria as a powerful planeswalker to generate card advantage and board control, while Crackling Drake and Niv-Mizzet, Parun serve as win conditions. The deck focuses on maintaining a balanced mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to stall the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Cleansing Nova, while also maintaining card advantage with Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta. The win condition of the deck is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Crackling Drake and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. By effectively managing resources and controlling the board, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can secure a victory.
